Honestly, if you haven't at least heard of portal you need to educate yourself. It's a very fun puzzle game involving portals, and don't even get me started on the speedrunning community.
If you're aiming for 100% you're in luck, it's very rewarding when you get that final achivement and I'm glad to add it to my completed games collection.
I reccomend this to anybody who's even slightly interested in it, because you should definitely at least play Portal once in your lifetime.

A pretty good puzzle game. Portal mechanic is unique and twist, although predictable is effective and the whole game is pretty fun. Some gripes I have is that GLaDOS's voice is pretty lifeless in this game and while you could make the argument that's the point they resigned it in Portal 2 and it's much better. Also the final fight feels pretty low stakes due to the only threats being the rockets and (here it comes) it's very short, it could use some more substance. But other than those 3 things I don'r really have any problems with it. 7/10

[b] Reasons to play: [/b]
[list]
    [*]You get a neat gun and a cool pair of boots
    [*]The radio music is an absolute bop
    [*]The cake is delicious and moist and definitely [strike] not [/strike] real
    [*][strike] Seriously, don't mind the warnings painted on walls [/strike]

Un jeu dont le gameplay est vraiment un des plus fun auquel j'ai pu jouer !
Le jeu n'est pas punitif (on a des sauvegardes automatiques et manuelles), ce qui fait qu'on ne se retrouve pas dans des situations frustrantes à devoir recommencer des puzzles qu'on en a marre de refaire. On a tout de même un très bon moteur de jeu physique qui marche très bien. Je n'ai en tout cas pas rencontré de bug majeur.
Pour ce qui est de l'histoire, on en apprends pas grand chose, mais assez pour en savoir quand même.
Un gros point fort règne tout de même dans l'écriture, l'humour est vraiment bien maîtrisé !

Je n'ai pas essayé les cartes avancées donc je ne peux les juger.

Pour conclure, je recommande ce jeu à quiconque veut découvrir Portal ou jouer à un petit jeu bien sympathique dont la campagne ne vous prendra pas beaucoup de temps (j'y ai mis 4-5h mais il est largement possible de faire moins, j'ai pas mal pris mon temps et ai un peu galéré à certains moments).

Ótimo jogo. Porém, o jogo sofre muito de sua dificuldade extremamente desnecessária quando se trata de conteúdos a parte da própria historia, como os desafios extras. As conquistas do jogo por exemplo, parecem ser impossíveis, podendo ser adquiridas com métodos dentro do jogo que você nem imaginaria ser algo proposital, como usar bugs e glitches a favor da própria gameplay do jogo, coisa que não foi nem um pouco do meu agrado e que em minha opinião não deveria estar incorporado na mesma. Fora tudo isso o jogo não deixa de ser muito bom quando se trata de seus quebra-cabeças e historia também, além de ser bem engraçado. Recomendo.

Amazing, absolutely incredible.

[h1]Overall Summary[/h1]

This game is one of my favorites of all time, and for good reason. Even though I could beat this within 2 hours now, it is fun to revisit it every now and then. It takes you back in time, to a place where Valve still made games. It brings out a sense that can only be described by the words "Why doesn't Valve make games anymore?"

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]

This type of gameplay was revolutionary back in 2007. The fact that you could get one place to another without walking brought a whole new mechanic to gaming. And it only gets better when they add momentum into the game To think that it was originally just an experiment, or bonus game, for the upcoming Orange Box, which included Half-Life 2 and Team Fortress 2 (both of which becoming pioneers to gaming as well), is just amazing. In my Portal 2 review I mention that it's a "Buffed Portal 1". I wouldn't say this is exactly a "nerfed Portal 2", but rather a more heavy one due to the atmosphere. The fact that there is no one in the sight other than you and an AI creates a somewhat melancholy feeling.

[h1]Story[/h1]

The story in Portal 1 is rather short, but it gets deeper the more you go into it. While I won't say everything, when you start to find the openings in the facility, it quickly escalates from a fun game with portals, into something larger. Not to mention, this game has one of the biggest plot twists in the history of gaming. I even knew about it before I played the game, mostly due to the saying [spoiler]"The Cake is a Lie"[/spoiler].

[h1]Music[/h1]

 There really isn't a huge soundtrack in this game compared to most games, but boy does it hit deep. When you load into the menu, you are met with this eerie drone that establishes a mysterious feeling. But when you a actually start the game, you get the famous portal radio song, which is happy and joyous compared to the menu drone. When you get more into the game, the music starts to become more ambiance than actual music. Then, you get to Test Chamber 10. The music here, "self esteem fund', [i]really[/i] sets an atmosphere. It is one of the creepiest, yet soothing pieces of music I've heard from a video game in years. Of course, we can't forget the amazing, yet simple performance that "Still Alive" is at the end of the game. It uses dark humor and sarcasm, both of which GLaDOS is.

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]

Portal 1 really holds a place in my heart as what I like to call a "simple, yet heavy game". The atmosphere that it creates is one that you can only find from this game, which is why this is one of my favorites of all-time.

tl;dr Get this game.
